folder: St. Edwards Street & Park Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
original_title: Brooklyn: St. Edwards Street - Park Avenue
text:
St. Edwards Street, east side, north from Park Ave., and opposite City Park.

October 31, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Park Avenue & St. Edwards Street, Brooklyn, NY
original_title: Brooklyn: Park Avenue - St. Edwards Street
text:
Park Avenue (tracks thereon) south side, east from St. Edwards Street to N. Elliott Place.  Still standing in the center of the block is the 3 1/2 story building of Thacker and Sons.

August 25, 1938

P.L. Sperr

folder: St. Edwards Street & Park Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
original_title: Brooklyn: St. Edwards Street - Park Avenue
text:
N. E. corner of St. Edwards St. & Park Ave., B'klyn
Aug. 23, 1939

P.L. Sperr, photographer

folder: St. Edwards Street & Park Avenue, Brooklyn, NY
original_title: Brooklyn: St. Edwards Street - Park Avenue
text:
City Park, west from St. Edwards Street (foreground, not shown), between Park (left) and Flushing (right) Aves., showing at the left and background, homes and factories on the south and east sides of Park Ave., and Navy Street, respectively.

October 31, 1927.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Park Avenue & St. Edwards Street, Brooklyn, NY
original_title: Brooklyn: Park Avenue - St. Edwards Street
text:
Park Avenue, west from St. Edwards Street (view 2). View 1 shows the south side of the avenue, running east across North Elliott Place to North Portland Avenue; shown, too (right), are Elliott Place houses.

View 2 shows the block from St. Edwards Street to North Elliott Place. These buildings will later be torn down.

View 3 is east from St. Edwards Street. The buildings shown in view 1 are all gone. Wallabout Houses and Fort Greene Houses were later erected here. For additional data see "New York Herald Tribune," November 18, 1941.

View 1: August 25, 1938
View 2: August 23, 1939
View 3: April 11, 1941

P. L. Sperr
